instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
820-000165 with no liquid damage wont turn on. All power rails good up to P3V3S3 which is only 0.12V checked for shorts on both rails are not shorted. I see PM_SLP_S4_L is responsible for P3V3S3 I have 0V on PM_SLP_S4_L but no shorts on either rail.

What to check next???

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: When checking pin 9 of U7100 noticed it was worked on before and was only getting 0.34V so changed ISL but in process the board made a snap noise and I now have a short on PPBUS_G3H. With all caps and ISL removed the short still remains. Is this a internal short at this point from using to much heat?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Remove F7140 and see where the short remains.
Which exact value (ohm scale) has that short?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
with F1740 starts at  0.10ohm and continuous climes to a higher number 1 by 1 every few seconds

without 0.395

checked everything with F7140 removed and short doesn't appear anywhere anymore. As soon as F1740 is back on o.10ohm and climbing returns. Tried different fuse but same result

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: current voltage on PPBUS_G3H 0.272V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
If you really have short on PPBUS_G3H, it MUST be present in one pad of F7140, once removed...
Disconnect charger and battery, when check diode mode, or ohm scale...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
0.90 with F7140 abnd 0.359 with removed.

W

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
0.90 with F7140 and 0.390 with it removed. Assuming I don't have a short at all now.

What to check next? PPBUS_G3H only 0.272V already replaced ISL6259

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
F7140 has two pads.
So if removed, you MUST get two different readings; for each pad.
And you should get higher values without fuse; this depends by measuring pad too.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Are you measuring in diode mode or resistance mode? Try resistance to ground on pins 1 and 2 of the fuse

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
With F7140 pad 1 0.135  pad 2 0.135

Without F7140 pad 1 0.014  pad 2 0.420

diode mode

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: We asked resistance not diode mode. However, that is not good on pin 1 so you have a short on pin one side of PPBUS more than likely.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
You do something wrong.
Cannot get lower reading without the fuse.
However, 135 (diode mode) is correct value.
No need to remove fuse then.
All I told to do is because you wrongly assumed a short there.

Be sure ISL6259 is properly soldered and post some voltages; 1, 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 14, 17, 19, 20, 27.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Pin 3 had a short so replaced ISL6259 and afterwards was  0.10V on pin 3 but 5V on pad one on R7110 R7111 and C7111 for a short bit and now 0V again and short returned.

This is the 3rd ISL 6259 I have replaced on this board now.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: replaced ISL6259 once again now 4.87V on R7110 R7111 and C7111 but only 0.15V  on the actual pin 3 of the ISL. My soldering is fine and traces look fine, no liquid damage on this board.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Short again on ISL6259. What to check to see what keeps shorting it? Already replaced D7105 R7105 C7105 C7111 R7111 R7110 R7186  R7185  C7185

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Sounds like a corroded trace or bad Q7180. Try replacing Q7180 and the ISL6259 at the same time.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Please, specify where the short is; and post the ohm value.
You must get aprox 4V on ACIN pin of U7100.
Check the trace from pin3 to R7110/11; with multimeter, not the eye!

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
short was on pin 3 and 0.5 ohm

replaced Q7180 and ISL at same time and so far short has not returned.

Only 2.5v and fluctuates down to 0.500V and back to 2.5V on pin 3. Ran jumper to rule out trace issue

Also still only 17.5V on pad 2 of  R7185 and C7185 but both have 18.5v on pad 1.

R7186 only 17.75V on pad 1 and 2

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Looks like leakage issue.
Charger detects it and get blocked and tries again and again.
3V42 also pulsing?

Try with fake charger, or bench power supply, using 60/85W power cable.

"Also still only 17.5V on pad 2 of R7185 and C7185 but both have 18.5v on pad 1."
Mmmh, then no leakage, if stable PPDCIN_G3H.
Remove C7111 and check again ACIN level.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
3v42 is fine at a steady 3.4V

I have been using bench power supply with 85 watt cable the whole time

With C7111 removed there is still a leakage issue on ACIN. voltage ranges from 0.100V to 2.5V to  3.4V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Board draws a steady 0.007 amps

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Change R7110/11; maybe U7100 too.

You can also try the trick to force 3v42 to pin 3.
In such case remove R7110; even R/C7111.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Only 2.6V with r7110 r7111 and C7111 removed

U7100 has been changed 4 times now, not sure if it needs to be changed again

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"Only 2.6V with r7110 r7111 and C7111 removed"
You should bring 3V42 there...

Be aware, without R7110/11 charge may not power up the board.
Is better to let R7110/11 soldered and cut off trace to pin 3/ISL6259.
Then bring 3V42 to ACIN pin.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
steady 3.4V on pin 3 ACIN pin now but  0V on pin 1

C7185 and R7185 pad 1 18.5V but only 7.52V on pad 2

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
All these values are correct now.
What happens with PPBUS_G3H?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H now 0v

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at L7130?
Post other voltages for U7100; pins 2, 12, 13, 14, 9, 15, 17, 19, 20, 26, 27.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
Do you get amber light on Magsafe?

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
0.7 L7130

U7100 pin 2 18.25V pin 12 3,4V pin 13 3.2V pin 14 1.3V pin 9 0.36V pin 15 0V pin 17 1.75V pin 19 5.10V pin 20 5.10V pin 26 0V pin 27 0V

resistance 17/18   23   27/28   20.8

yes amber light on charger

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"pin 14 1.3V
-----------------
pin 9 0.36V
--------------
pin 17 1.75V
------------
pin 27 0V
--------------
resistance 17/18 23"
All bad values.

Change Q7180 and come back with news.
Also check R7121/22 and R7180/81/85/86.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
changed Q7180 and checked R7121/22 and R7180/81/85/86. All values are good.

pin 14 3.4V

pin 9 3.4V

pin 17 1.636V

pin 27 0v

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: resistance 17/18 1.320

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"pin 9 3.4V"
This is the result of
"resistance 17/18 1.320"
So check R7150/51/52 and their traces to U7100...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: replaced and checked R7150/51/52 and checked traces. All are good but still same results

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: when checking R7150 noticed have 0.003 short to ground. When Q7130 is removed short is gone but once Q7130 is replaced and soldered back on short returns.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: I've had one like this before. It could very well be an internal board short which would be hopeless :(

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Did you change Q7130 with good one?
After change it, check diode mode on F7140 before powering the board.
As above mentioned, be sure R/C7125 traces.
Do NOT power untill check all traces OK.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
As far as I know Q7130 should be good. Pulled it from donar board,

0.141 diode mode now on F7140. All traces look good, no liquid damage on this board. History is store claimed board was working fine and that it just suddenly died.

Waiting for response if I should check anything else before I power board again

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Yes, checked traces with meter

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Check for short between R7120 and L7130.
Be sure to have ALL traces good for CHGR_PHASE; to U7100, C7125, L/Q7130...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
no short between R7120 and L7130

All traces good for CHGR_PHASE; to U7100, C7125, L/Q7130

PPBUS_G3H currently .510V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Post again voltages for U7100...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Came back to this board.

Replaced ISL6250 and Q7010 again. PPBUS_G3H fluctuates between 2-4V now

ISL measurements

Pin 2 18V

Pin 12 3.42V

Pin 13 1.30V

pin 14 0.882 V

pin 9 0.34V

pin 15 0.50V

pin 17 1.75V

pin 19 5V

pin 20 5V

pin 26 17.80V

pin 27 18V

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
"Pin 13 1.30V"
Are you sure?
It comes from SMC_RESET_L, which is not present in such case; unless R7100 is broken...

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message: Pretty sure I killed the board by mistake. Replaced Q7130 since pin 1 was 0. Replacement Q7130 was not soldered properly and now there is a constant short to ground on  F7140 as soon as Q7130 is soldered.

threads.title: 820-000165 wont turn on
threads.message:
Remove F7140.
If short remains on L7130 side, then replace Q7130, U7100 and C7125.
Be sure to have good trace from pin1/Q7130 to pin 24/U7100.
